definition: to wrap one's arm around (used to describe the girth of a tree trunk)
100 ml/one-tenth of a peck/measure for dry grain equal to one-tenth of sheng 升 or liter, or one-hundredth dou 斗
to close/to join/to fit/to be equal to/whole/together/round (in battle)/conjunction (astronomy)/1st note of pentatonic scale/old variant of 盒[he2]
to hold/to carry (in one's arms)/to hug/to embrace/to surround/to cherish

sentences.english: This old tree is so big that even three men can't hold it together.
sentences.chinese: 这颗古树非常的高大，三个成年人都无法合抱。

sentences.english: I still remember that big old tree growing at the gate of my village, which takes three people to embrace.
sentences.chinese: 村庄旁边就有一株需要3个人才能合抱的古枫树。

sentences.english: Great oaks from little acorns grow.
Latina encircle the tree, the door parked fishing boat.
sentences.chinese: 庭罗合抱树，门泊钓鱼船。

definition: reach high to the sky/tall/of great height
classifier for trees, cabbages, plants etc
